column2: First - ensure that young people feel safe/comfortable to scrutinise policing
column5: To have open dialogues with police about why they have negative feelings towards them. Share their personal experiences.
column6: encourage young people into cadets so that they can develop rapports with people who can assist them in the scrutiny of police.
column7: do regular, independent investigations on police conduct and present data to young people so they can hold conversations about the findings.
column8: Have talks with police officers at events to debate with them about the justice system and what may need to change
column9: educate young people on the history of policing so that they can identify negative/detrimental patterns in police behaviour.
column10: To offer the young people incentives
column11: Allow them to be at the forefront of the decision making
